title: Favorite Team UI
custom_preconds: Clear the saved Favorite team
custom_steps:
1. Launch the app without save data.
2. Ensure that all expected results pass.
custom_expected:
* App launches and displays the Favorite Team page:
* The title of the page, **FAVORITE TEAM**, is centered at the top of the page
* 3 columns are displayed below the title: **American League**, <untitled>, **National League**
* The **American League** and **National League** columns contain 3 columns: **EAST**, **CENTRAL**, and **WEST**
* The center column contains the following Welcome text: Select your favorite team to personalize the MLB Home page. You can change your favorite team at any time in the Settings menu.
* Each of the division columns displays a team tile for the 5 teams in that division
* A team tile consists of the team logo with the team name below the logo; both the logo and the name are centered within the tile
* The team tiles for each division are arranged alphabetically from top to bottom
* A disabled **Next** button is displayed below the center column

Design: 
* Favorite Team page: https://zpl.io/Vk7YwX8
* Welcome text for center column: https://zpl.io/VKQGMGR

title: Navigate Favorite Team Page
custom_preconds: Clear the saved Favorite Team if it's been set previously
custom_steps:
1. Launch the app
2. Using the d-pad and/or left analog stick (may also use right analog stick), navigate to each of the 30 team tiles
custom_expected:
1. The app launches and lands on the Favorite Team page
2. As each team tile gains focus:
* The tile grows (and the previously highlighted tile shrinks back to normal size)
* The tile's background changes to the team's primary color
* The tile's border changes to the team's secondary color
* The center column shows info about the team (team wordmark, team name, team's stadium name, and team web site)

Design: 
* Favorite Team page: https://zpl.io/Vk7YwX8
* Examples of all team highoight colors: https://zpl.io/2GRp9Wm

title: Attempt To Select More Than One Favorite Team
custom_preconds: Either have no favorite team selected OR clear local storage
custom_steps:
1. Launch the app to the favorite team page

3. Navigate back to the team tiles and select a second favorite team
custom_expected:
1. Favorite team page is shown with no team selected, and the Next button is disabled.
2. Selected team is highlighted and focus moves to the now-enabled Next button
3. Team selected in step 2 is no longer highlighted and the new favorite team is highlighted; focus moves to the enabled Next button

title: Not Logged In
custom_preconds: Log out of app if you're previously logged in
custom_steps: 1. Launch the app without logging in
custom_expected:
App launches and lands on the Home page:

* There are 8 items in the navigation header at the top of the screen
* The 5 items are left-justified
* The MLB logo ( **not clickable** ), **Home** tab, **Games** tab,  **Clips** tab & **Shows** tab
* The three items are right-justified
* The **Log In** button, the **Get MLB.TV** button & the **Settings** button

**Notes**

* User must select a team during the onboarding process. This is eligible for change in the future.
* The focus will be on the **Home** tab when the app first launches.

title: Change Pages On Home Screen Logged out
custom_preconds: Log out of app if you're previously logged in
custom_steps:
1. Launch the app without logging in
2. Use the d-pad or left analog stick to move along the header navigation bar to the **Settings** tab
3. Move from **Home** -> **Games** -> **Clips** -> **Shows** -> **Log in** -> **Get MLB.TV** -> **Settings** then reverse the order.

**Note:**
You must always be able to use the left analog stick to navigate; the right analog stick can also be used but it is not a requirement that it work.
custom_expected:
1. App launches and lands on the Home page:
* There are 8 items in the navigation header at the top of the screen (The MLB logo is not selectable) 
2. The highlight starts on the **Home** tab
3. The focus shifts from **Home** -> **Games** -> **Clips** -> **Shows** -> **Log in** -> **Get MLB.TV** -> **Settings** then reverses the order.

**Note:** 
As the focus shifts, the Pill shifts over to the item in focus.  
The tabs (Home, Game & Settings) are light gray when not in focus. When in focus the tabs text becomes white. (The white Text only shifts when a tab is selected)
The **Home** tab should remain as White text since nothing was selected

title: Pre Game show Game tile design
custom_preconds:
Pre game show must be available/ live.
User must be entitled to live games.
custom_steps:
1.launch app
2. Navigate to the Games page.
3. Verify the game tile with the **Pre Game Show** is behaving as expected.
custom_expected:
**Before** the Pregame show has started, the game tile shows the start time of the game.
**Once the Pregame show has started** (start times provided by club), the game tile shows a “Live” indicator.
-If both clubs have a pre-game show, show copy “Pregame Shows”.
-If only one club has a pre-game show, show club 3-letter name eg. “OAK: Pregame Show”.
**Once the Game is live** (game start time has passed), only show the red “Live” indicator.
**Once the game is Final** , the game tile continues to show a “Live” indicator until the game is complete.

**NOTES:**

* This behavior remains the same irrespective of Hide Spoilers
* If neither club has a pre/post show, then game tiles follow existing rules and only show: start time->Live->Final
* When the EPG service is sorting games, it should give games that have live pre/post shows the same priority as when the main game is live.
* If the games are in scheduled state, use the Game start time (not the pregame start time) to sort the games in the right order

title: Post Game Show Game Tile Design
custom_preconds: Post game show must be available/ live
custom_steps:
1.launch app
2. Navigate to the Games page.
3. Verify the game tile with the **Post Game Show** is behaving as expected.
custom_expected:
Once the game is Final, the game tile continues to show a “Live” indicator until the Postgame show is complete.
- If both clubs have a post-game show, show copy “Postgame Show”.
- If only one club has a post-game show, show club 3-letter name eg. “OAK: Postgame Show
When the post-game show is over (Media=off), the game tile shows “Final” or Final/inning 

**NOTES:**

* If the game tile has a “Perfect Game” tag, hide this tag while showing the Postgame label due to lack of space. The “Perfect Game” tag can be shown again after the Postgame is over.
* This behavior remains the same irrespective of Hide Spoilers
* If neither club has a pre/post show, then game tiles follow existing rules and only show: start time->Live->Final
* When the EPG service is sorting games, it should give games that have live pre/post shows the same priority as when the main game is live.
* If the games are in scheduled state, use the Game start time (not the pregame start time) to sort the games in the right order

title: Clips Page Carousel UI
custom_preconds:
MAST Endpoint to check carousels: https://mastapi.mobile.mlbinfra.com/api/video/v1/playlist?topic=clips
you can change your teamId to the relevant team by adding **&teamId=<teamId>** to the url

Alternatively you can visit mlb.com/tv and compare the carousels.
custom_steps:
Navigate to Clips page
Scroll up and down through all the carousels
Scroll side to side on each carousel
custom_expected:
Clips page loads VOD and SVOD content in carousels returned by MAST API
SVOD content requires SUBSCRIBERVOD entitlement. Lock icon should show when not entitled. 
displayType = "Featured" should be the larger sized tiles

Navigation should be smooth. Each carousel can hold up to 25 items

title: Hide Spoilers On
custom_preconds:
App must be installed 
The **Hide Spoilers** feature should be set to "On"
custom_steps:
1. Launch the app and verify that **Hide Spoilers** is On.
2. Navigate to the **Clips** Page
3. Verify that there are no spoilers displaying in the carousels or in the feature spot.
custom_expected:
In the Feature Spot:
* IF Hide Spoilers is ON, the Hero Content shall be hidden with a message displaying "To view this content, turn Hide Spoilers off."

In the carousels:
* Hide spoilers should black out the entire carousel that has been flagged by forge as hide spoilers true.
* The Carrousel should be blacked out and display the text "Hide Spoilers is On. Select to turn it off."
* Response from Forge are as follows:

Hide Spoilers True:

-Favorite Team Highlights
-Most Popular
-Daily Recaps
-Condensed Games
-Manager Postgame
-Home Runs
-MLB Network VOD
-Statcast
-Curtain Calls
-Walk Offs

Hide Spoilers False:

-Fastcast
-Top Games of 2021
-Defense
-Quick Pitch recap
-Cut4

title: Scrubber Bar: Live Video
custom_preconds:
Requires a LIVE game not subject to blackout
User is logged in with a subscriber account
custom_steps:
1. Launch the app
2. Navigate to a live game
3. Play the live game
custom_expected:
1. The app launches
2.
3. Live game starts streaming
* Scrubber bar appears over the video
* The scrubber bar is filled in with the pin appearing on the far right-hand side of the scrubber bar
* Scrubber bar shows milestones/inning information as they are completed and reflects the full elapsed time of the live game
* Milestones in the scrubber bar is compressed from the right as the stream plays
* Placement of milestones reflects each half-inning's duration
* Elapsed time is on the far left of the scrubber bar
* When at the Live point; "Live" appears on the far right of the scrubber bar.
* When behind the Live point the time is displayed on the far right of the scrubber bar.

title: Play/Pause Button
custom_preconds: Need access to either a Live OR Archived game
custom_steps:
1. Stream a live or archived game for a couple minutes
2. Press the X button
3. Wait 2 minutes
4. Press the X button
custom_expected:
1. Game is streaming
2. Video pauses and scrubber bar is displayed
3. After 5 seconds, the scrubber bar is dismissed and video remains paused
4. Video resumes playing from the pause point

title: Scrubber Bar: VOD Game
custom_steps:

2. Navigate to any archived game

3. Archived game starts streaming

title: Options
custom_steps:
1. Stream a game (Live OR Archived)
2. Use the d-pad to bring up the scrubber
3. Use the d-pad to bring up the options menu
4. Use the d-pad to navigate to the Audio Options button
5. Use the d-pad to navigate to the CC button
6. Use the d-pad down button to focus on the scrubber bar
7. Use the d-pad down button to dismiss the scrubber bar and options buttons
custom_expected:
1. Video is streaming
2. Scrubber bar is displayed
3. Options menu is displayed
* Video Options button is left-justified above the scrubber bar and is highlighted
* Audio Options button is to the right of the Video Options button
* CC button is to the right of the Audio Options button
4. The highlight moves from the Video Options button to the Audio Options button
5. The highlight moves from the Audio Options button to the CC button
6. Focus returns to the scrubber bar 
7. The scrubber bar and Options button is dismissed

Repeat steps 2-7 with the left analog stick

title: Audio Options
custom_steps:
1. Stream a game (Live OR Archived)
2. Use either the d-pad or the left analog stick to bring up the scrubber bar
3. Use either the d-pad or the left analog stick to bring up the options menu
4. Use either the d-pad or the left analog stick to navigate to the Audio Options button
5. Select the Audio Options button
6. Use either the d-pad or the left analog stick to move back and forth through all of the audio streams
custom_expected:
1. Video streams
2. Scrubber bar is displayed
3. Options menu is displayed above the scrubber bar
4. The Audio Options button is highlighted
5. The Audio Options opens and displays the available audio streams:
* If there is a team associated with the audio stream, the team logo is displayed to the left of the audio stream name
* If there is no team associated with the audio stream, just the audio stream name is displayed
* None of the audio streams are highlighted (highlight = underline of audio stream name)
6. The currently highlighted audio stream is underlined (the underline is as long as the audio stream name and includes the team logo if available)

app is installed
user should have valid credentials

title: Initiate FF and Stop - Archived

2. Press the d-pad Right arrow once and wait 5 seconds
3. Press the X button
custom_expected:
1. Game is streaming
2. Scrubber bar is displayed, RR/REW box is displayed and shows FF at 2x speed (> icon), video is paused
3. Game playback point has advanced by roughly 10 seconds

Repeat all 3 steps 
* using R2 instead of the d-pad in step 2
* using the Left analog stick instead of the d-pad in step 2

Repeat all 3 steps for 4 8 16 and 32x FF 4X should FF for 40secs, 8x 5min 20 secs, 16x 21min 20secs, 32x 1hour 25 sec

2. Press the d-pad Left arrow once and wait 5 seconds
3. Press the X button
custom_expected:

3. Game playback point has retreated by roughly 10 seconds

Repeat all 3 steps 

* using L2 instead of the d-pad in step 2
* using the Left analog stick instead of the d-pad in step 2

Repeat all 3 steps for 4 8 16 and 32x RWD 4X should RWD for 40secs, 8x 5min 20 secs, 16x 21min 20secs, 32x 1hour 25 sec

custom_steps:

custom_expected:

* Once the game resumes, verify the inning and score reflect the final inning and score displayed in the FF/REW box from step 3

* the current view point/time approaching 01:15:00
* current inning reflects the inning (top or bottom) at that point in the game (and scrubber bar)
* current score reflects the score at that point in the game
6. The FF/REW box is dismissed:
*  Once the game resumes, verify the inning and score reflect the final inning and score displayed in the FF/REW box from step 5
